content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve this contribution, because it is a good exercise. Fun to solve. I had to think a bit and for once this is not about maths stuff that I found annoying.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: solved in 6 minutes in python. my code in a while loop remove 1s from right and 0s from left. swap of rindex "0" and index "1". repeat. fun exercise many ways to solve

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: My solution: 

```
n = int(input())
s = input()

ss = sorted(s)
count = 0

for i, cc in enumerate(ss): 
    if s[i] != cc and cc == "0": 
        count +=1
print(count)
```


The exercise is not so complicated about coding but about how to solve it.

It is an excellent exercise because good comprehension of the description is essential (I missed the fact that it had to be sorted from 0 to 1)

My first solution was solving the problem for both sorting orders, and the final tests helped me re-read the statement correctly.
